channel.title: Demo on Sitting Duck Info
channel.description: Recent content in Demo on Sitting Duck Info

item.title: The Sitting Duck Info Story
item.description: Many years ago, Sarah had a vision. She wanted the world to be more like a duck.

item.title: Story's Theme Features
item.description: Story has a lot of features, but most are optional and have smart defaults! This page is an introduction to Story, with links to further pages that go into more details. There’s also a listing of features that either don’t need a separate documentation page, or just don’t have full documentation yet.

item.title: Story's Feature Flags
item.description: Feature flags, which are called classes in the markup, control many of Story’s features. You can enable and disable them in your site config, or in an individual post’s front matter. This article documents Story’s feature flags.

item.title: Story's Figures, Captions, and Tables
item.description: Story can automatically transform images into figures with captions. It can also add captions to tables. And it adds features and styling to both images and tables. This article is a demo of Story’s features for figures, tables, and captions.

item.title: Story's Image Formatting Controls
item.description: This article is a demo of Story’s image-related features (other than figure captions). Story can apply a variety of stylistic and layout transformations to your images. These features are enabled by unobtrusive, accessibility-friendly tricks that give you more control over images than Markdown typically provides. Story also has out-of-the-box support for header and preview images, for a visually stunning site.

item.title: Story's JavaScript Search
item.description: This article documents Story’s built-in search features, which don’t rely on external search engines. Story uses the LunrJS library to provide fast browser-based search. This page first explains how search setup works, and then provides copy-paste ready code samples for you to use.

item.title: Story's Music Notation
item.description: Story uses the abcjs library to transform abc music notation into “sheet music” dynamically. This works well for displaying a wide variety of music notation in a web browser conveniently, without embedding images or PDFs or the like.

item.title: Story's Mathematical Equation Typesetting
item.description: This article is a demo of Story’s ability to typeset mathematical equations, both inline and in block form.

item.title: Story's Typography
item.description:
This article is a demo of Story’s beautiful typography.

Story is designed to showcase long-form content such as essays and technical blog posts. It is built for readability and grace in both screen and print media at all sizes.

item.title: Story's MailChimp Integration Features
item.description: If you’re a blogger, you might use MailChimp to build a subscriber list, and Story makes that easy. MailChimp also has the ability to automatically send your new content to the list from an RSS feed, and guess what—Story helps you create an RSS feed customized just for that if you like, too.
